analysis_successful_prompt: Evaluate if the call was successful: 1) Was a support ticket created? 2) Did the agent collect contact info (name, phone/email, preference)? 3) Was the issue clearly described with type and priority? 4) If a technician was assigned, was transfer attempted? A successful call ends with a ticket number confirmed or transfer completed.
analysis_summary_prompt: Summarize in 1-3 sentences: Who called (name, company if mentioned), what IT issue they reported (incident vs service request), ticket number created, and outcome (transferred to tech, or ticket logged for follow-up).

general_tools.name: end_call
general_tools.description: End the call when user has to leave (like says bye) or you are instructed to do so.

general_tools.name: transfer_call
general_tools.description: Transfer the call to a human agent when transfer_phone is available

general_tools.name: lookupCompanyContact
general_tools.description: Look up company and contact in Autotask. Input: organizationName, firstName, lastName, createIfNotFound (optional). Returns companyId, contactId, emailAddress, phone, isNew, message.

general_tools.name: createTicket
general_tools.description: Create an Autotask ticket (service request or incident). Requires companyId from lookupCompanyContact. Input: companyId, contactId, isNewContact, contactName, contactPhone, contactEmail, preferredContactMethod, issueDescription, title, ticketType (1=Service Request, 2=Incident), priority (4=P1, 1=P2, 2=P3, 5=P4), externalID.

general_tools.name: getTicket
general_tools.description: Retrieve details of an existing Autotask ticket. Input: ticketId. Returns ticketNumber, title, ticketStatus, priority, assignedTech, transferPhone.
